title: Daughtry
description: Daughtry Forrester has a good life. He loves his club, his family, and working on custom builds. What he doesn’t love is the pressure the women in his life have put on him to hire a female mechanic. While trying to juggle health problems and a camera crew who’s always underfoot, Daughtry doesn’t put much faith in his new hire. Sure that she won’t fit in or be able to keep up, he’s confident that the woman he’s hired will pack up her tools and run away crying as soon as she messes up her manicure. That will take at least one problem off his plate and he’ll finally be able to tell the meddling women in his life, “I told you so!”Jamie Evans has been working in a shop since she was big enough to hold a wrench. Her passion is restoring cars and motorcycles to an even better version of their former glory. Not a stranger to life in a garage, she’s dealt with her fair share of people who don’t think she can pull her weight. What they don’t realize is that she has already left most of them in her dust with the strides she’s made in her profession. Not one to advertise her accomplishments, she walks into the garage with a clean slate as just another unknown, albeit female, mechanic.When Daughtry and Jamie meet, the fireworks start and it’s going to take dedication for them to keep that spark alive so they can make it to their own grand finale - a life together.
author: Cee Bowerman
